intro: Myctirophora, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Urticaceae. These plants are characterized by their opposite, simple leaves that often have a hairy or glandular surface. Myctirophora species typically produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
